title: Is kys really such a huge deal?
body:
TL;DR I wrote kys to an opposing Akali player when she dashed through a wall and said "pussy champ". This got me an immediate (like 3 minutes later) 14 day ban for that game alone. Is the phrase "kys" really that offensive to the people at riot? Cause if it is, why? Trashtalking has literally been taken out of the game lmao.

Here's the chat logs I was banned for

> Game 1
Pre-Game
Totpoter: XanaxEater lmao
In-Game
Totpoter: gg
Totpoter: like you know how to play this character
Totpoter: could not give any less shits
Totpoter: kys
Totpoter: pussy champ
Totpoter: no
Totpoter: such a %%%%%%
Totpoter: akali players kys
Totpoter: ?
Totpoter: why die for mountain
Totpoter: useless drk
Totpoter: ?
Totpoter: 4ppl ok
Totpoter: yh
Totpoter: gg

replies.body: As the OP seems to be asking the question "is KYS really such a huge deal" in bad faith and not keeping an open mind to responses, I see no productive path forward for this thread. As such, I will be locking it.

The act of encouraging another human being to commit suicide for **any** reason (minus a few extremely rare exceptions such as terminal illness, which don’t apply in League ever at all by a long shot) should offend **everyone**.

It’s absolutely unacceptable to encourage another human being to commit suicide simply because you are unhappy with them.

Homophobia and encouragement to self-harm is not the sort of banter that's allowed. It's not *banter*, period. It's needlessly offensive and aggressive language (and the homophobic part is also hate speech). So yes, it is a pretty big deal.

Most sports and organizations ban trash talk of this level, and *League* is no exception. You're allowed competitive banter, but the point of banter is that -- while it can be a little insulting -- it's intended in good fun and ultimate not disrespectful past a certain point. This is *not* that. This is encouragement to self-harm and homophobic hate speech. Those are not fun.
